data.title: Bob Chantler – Page 12 – Weald and Downland Churches
data.text:
Bepton Church Church of St Mary Off Bugshill Lane, Bepton, West Sussex GU29 0HX » View on Map Between 1180 and 1185, at the end of the Norman era, construction of a church of flint and stone rubble was started with a tower on Read More …

Fordwich Church Church of St Mary the Virgin The Drove, Fordwich, Kent CT2 0DB » View on Map At the eastern end of the nave of St Mary’s there are ‘long and short’ quoins of Quarr stone, from the Isle Read More …

Paddlesworth Church Church of St Oswald Upper Arpinge, Paddlesworth, Kent CT18 8AD » View on Map St Oswalds at Paddlesworth is a small two cell Norman church dating from the late 11th or early 12th century. There are north and Read More …

Capel-le-Ferne Church Church of St Mary Manor House Lane, Capel-le-Ferne, Folkestone, Kent CT18 7EX » View on Map The parish church of St Mary, Caple-le-Ferne dates from the 12th century, but was made redundant in 1986 and vested in the Read More …

Barfreston Church Church of St Nicholas Barfreston Road, Barfreston, Kent CT15 7JQ » View on Map The Norman church of St Nicholas at Barfreston dates from c1180. It is one of the most important examples of late 12th century church Read More …

West Stourmouth Church Church of All Saints Church Lane, West Stourmouth, Kent CT3 1HT » View on Map All Saints is a redundant Grade I listed building now under the care of the Churches Conservation Trust. The church is set near Read More …

Rotherfield Church Church of St Deny Church Road, Rotherfield, East Sussex TN6 3LG » View on Map St Deny’s Parish Church Rotherfield is a Grade 1 listed building dating from c1060, evidenced by external Saxon stonework at the north east Read More …

Bidborough Church Church of St Lawrence 3 High Street, Bidborough, Kent TN3 0UJ » View on Map The Church of St Lawrence, Bidborough dates from the 10th century, part of the north wall of the chancel being Saxon masonry work. Read More …

Mayfield Church The Church of St Dunstan High Street, Mayfield, East Sussex TN20 6AQ »View on Map Initially built of logs from the Weald forests, a church at Mayfield was founded by St Dunstan, Archbishop of Canterbury 960-978 Read More …

Capel Church, Tonbridge Church of St Thomas à Becket Church Lane, Capel, Tonbridge TN12 6SX » View on Map St Thomas à Becket was originally a chapel of ease serving the local people who lived some distance from the Read More …
